qas.question: What natural disaster caused detrimental effects to the Irrawaddy section of Burma in May of 2008 ?
What is the main crop of the delta of the Irrawaddy section of Burma?
How many people were reported missing or deceased due to the natural disaster of 2007 ?
How much was the financial cost of the damages of the 2007 natural disaster in Burma ?
Did the government of Myanmar welcome the international efforts of assistance?

answers.text: Myanmar's isolationist government was accused of hindering United Nations recovery efforts

context: In May 2008, <a0_0>Cyclone Nargis<a0_0/> caused extensive damage in the densely populated, <a1_0>rice<a1_0/>-farming delta of the Irrawaddy Division. It was the worst natural disaster in Burmese history with reports of an <a2_0>estimated 200,000 people dead or missing<a2_0/>, and damage totalled to <a3_0>10 billion US Dollars<a3_0/>, and as many as 1 million left homeless. In the critical days following this disaster, <a4_0>Myanmar's isolationist government was accused of hindering United Nations recovery efforts<a4_0/>. Humanitarian aid was requested but concerns about foreign military or intelligence presence in the country delayed the entry of United States military planes delivering medicine, food, and other supplies.
